info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 8:54AM EDT until April 6 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Flatrock River at Saint Paul.
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...
Haw Creek near Clifford.
Fall Creek at Millersville.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Haw Creek near Clifford.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, Near major flooding in progress along Haw Creek. Flooded roads include CR 450 N, Rocky Ford Road, 10th Street and Marr Road according to Columbus Response Plan.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 13.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM EDT Saturday was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 14.3 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall just after midnight tonight. It will rise to 14.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around midnight EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON
